project.title: Price Checker
project.short_description: As a hardware design lead, I developed a smart price checker for retail that delivers instant product details (price, name, image, discounts) to customers. The cost-effective device is now actively used in large hypermarkets, integrating seamlessly without requiring store infrastructure changes.

details.overview: ​As a hardware designer, I led the development of an innovative, cost-effective price checker specifically designed for retail environments. This device is tailored to enhance customer experience by providing immediate and accurate product information, including price, name, discount details, and product images, directly at the point of interest. The smart price checker is currently produced and utilized in large hypermarkets, demonstrating its effectiveness and reliability in real-world retail settings. Its deployment offers a seamless integration into existing store infrastructures without requiring additional investments.​
goals: Achieve a 50% reduction in unit cost through design optimization for mass production.
Enable plug-and-play compatibility with all major retail software systems for instant integration.
Develop universal hardware and API standards to eliminate custom setups and accelerate onboarding.
key_features: Multi-language support via configurable fonts to serve diverse markets.
Smart advertisement engine that suggests alternative products post-scan to promote savings.
Cost-effective hardware design centered on ESP32 and a single 3.5" LCD.
Seamless, wireless communication for content updates and real-time price sync.

enhancements.challenge: The original antenna control unit struggled with connection stability in harsh marine conditions (up to force 10 winds), used low-grade sensors that failed in high-vibration environments, and had monolithic firmware that was difficult to maintain and scale.
enhancements.solution: We completely redesigned the system with industrial-grade sensors, implemented a 6-schedule PID loop with deterministic timing, added EKF-based sensor fusion for stability, and created a modular firmware architecture using FreeRTOS for better maintainability and scalability.
